revised_title: Metabolism and Feeding in Antarctic Brachiopods: A Low Energy Lifestyle
tldr: This study investigates the metabolism and feeding response of the Antarctic brachiopod Liothyrella uva, a species with a low energy lifestyle. The specific dynamic action (sda) response was found to be low and on a longer timescale than previous sda responses. The metabolic scope was restricted, with a peak metabolic rate 1.64 times higher than the pre-feeding basal metabolic rate. The study shows that L. uva uses protein almost exclusively to fuel metabolism, indicating an adaptation to its low energy lifestyle in the Antarctic environment.
